website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best KitchenAid stand mixer designed for use in the home – its convenient features and impressive power top other models but costs significantly more than the Artisan by KitchenAid.
pros: Sports a large-capacity 7-quart bowl and professional-quality motor and bowl lift – which some prefer as it allows you to more easily add ingredients
Comes with loads of attachments – flat beater, wire whip, and dough hook
cons: May not fit under some kitchen counters

website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best KitchenAid stand mixer designed for use in the home – its convenient features and impressive power top other models and rival the Commercial Series.
pros: Sports a large-capacity 7-quart bowl and professional-quality motor and bowl lift
Comes with compelling attachments – flat beater, wire whip, and dough hook
cons: Falls on the high end of the price spectrum – but if you are looking for the best for your kitchen, you won't be shocked by the price

customer_reviews.title: dissappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a bigger and stronger mixer while using 9 years old 4.5Qt mixer. Through many reviews and videos, I choose Proline 7Qt. KSM7586P and decided to buy it. This mixer, powered by a DC motor, was attractive for its power and quietness. As soon as I received this beautiful mixer, I unpacked it, turned it on, and tested it. OMG... Noise was repeated while rotating. As the speed increased, it sounded like a Steam locomotive sound. Another defect was found. the paint was peeled off. When I finished the test, I asked for a return. And Amazon handled the return quickly.
customer_reviews.author: jwpapa

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my Artesian
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after America’s Test Kitchen review YouTube. I had issues with my 4qt bumping up and down with double batches. Clearance was right, just a cheap build. Finished my first double bread recipe, and this was a dream. I could see the flour incorporating the liquids smoothly, no bumping, and I didn’t have dough climbing into uncleanable parts. Ground whole wheat with the attachment I had for the 4qt, no issues with compatibility. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: OZ

customer_reviews.title: Initial reactions
customer_reviews.text: Probably damaged in shipping, Amazon should not have repacked something that heavy to ship on it’s side. It defeats the carefully engineered styrofoam interior. KitchenAid Is sending out a new replacement. The beater to bowl clearance was off, and the adjustment screw wouldn’t turn far enough to compensate. That said, it is the quietest KitchenAid we’ve owned. Love the bowl size and handle. Purchased the beater with the silicon scraper blade, and so far think the third party blade from Metro works better. (But they don’t make a blade for this model yet.) Looking forward to being able to mix larger qualities, and heavier dough.
customer_reviews.author: Point Design

customer_reviews.title: Bad paint job
customer_reviews.text: This is the replacement one I got. Didn’t give five stars because the paint job on this machine is poor. The paint has wrinkled at the base when it was bumped. Not good. Makes great bread dough, butter in half the time. It is a powerful machine.
customer_reviews.author: Pd and J

customer_reviews.title: A monster, and very pretty finish!
customer_reviews.text: This is a monster! Heavy and powerful. I use this mixer for large batches (5 to 8 cups of flour) of bread dough, and unlike my previous mixer this one does not bog down. Some reviews claim "clicking" noises or premature failure, but so far I have no complaints or concerns. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J

customer_reviews.title: Great Reliable Blender
customer_reviews.text: I got this blender almost a year ago, have used it like crazy. So far it's taking the abuse of constant use. Still working like new. Great for blending dough for bread, and pastries. It is very heavy so its not something that you want to be moving around all the time. I've had at least 6 other blenders before this brand, and I can say that even though this was expensive. It was worth every penny. Recommend this brand over all the other lower priced brands out there.
customer_reviews.author: J. Basulto

customer_reviews.title: What a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this mixer to help with the home made dog treats my husband created. The dough was very heavy and took a lot of effort on his part. He didn't think any mixer would be able to handle it. Not only did it handle the dough, but we were able to make three batches in the time it took for him to make one. AND he came away with energy to spare. And it has done anything I have attempted to date. I LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Edith Luken

customer_reviews.title: Its beauty is 2nd to only one in my kitchen! 👍⭐️😁
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? This mixer costs a premium 💰 but it’s super nice, quiet 🤫 (imo) and can mix all the 🍪 cookies, pizza 🍕, or bread 🥖 that you want. Its sturdy, ours is beautiful candy apple red and has a great stainless steel bowl that snaps into place very easily. No complains yet and we’ve owned ours for approx 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Let’s get baking
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Kitchenaid mixer. My first belonged to my mother and I inherited that one. It was too small for my needs so I purchased the 5 qt. I was amazed with its style and color but as I gained more baking skills I needed another one that was bigger and bolder. I looked at several to include the 8 qt commercial grade. Found the 8 qt too large for my needs so I chose this one. Best choice ever made. It’s quieter than past ones and still have extra room to make more batches at once.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Doucette

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this mixer. I got this for my wife this past Christmas. So far she absolutely loves it. Had read some reviews that said theirs made a horrible grinding noise while in operation and I was a bit apprehensive, but to date we have had no issues. Machine had no problem with making several large batches of chocolate chip cookies for the holidays. We don’t make anything like bread, so haven’t truly tested it’s capabilities. But we’ve been happy with the unit thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Gerwin

customer_reviews.title: This is not your mothers kithenAid
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a machine. It did worry me when I tried bagels, dont think I'll try that again. Dough too heavy even for this monster. So far double batch cookies, bread, butter with no problem. If you do a lot of baking this is the right choice. The price difference between this one and the lesser model is a not an issue for what you get. SAve up and go for the 7 quart you will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostspawn

customer_reviews.title: Was happy to report this thing handles as much cookie dough ...
customer_reviews.text: Wife destroyed her 2007 Artisan. She wanted a mixer that would handle large cookie dough loads. Was torn between getting another Kitchenaid and a commercial one form a local restraunt supply house. Was happy to report this thing handles as much cookie dough as she can throw at it. Saved money over the commercial one and this one matches our pro line kitchenaid appliances.
customer_reviews.author: jetfxr

customer_reviews.title: KitchenAid is like a overpriced car...
customer_reviews.text: ... the price is not competitive to other brands which probably are even easier to use. However, people like me love the retro look of a KitchenAid. I would buy this over any other brand any time just because of that alone. That said, this particular model is kinda cumbersome to use. The bowl needs to be snapped into place with quite some force. That should be a lot easier (without sacrificing the look).
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Kirchhoff

customer_reviews.title: Best gift I've given myself in years.
customer_reviews.text: I have always used a hand mixer. After lumpy potatoes and cake mixes, I decided to buy a stand mixer. I have a very large family so I opted for the large 7qt. model. A larger investment to begin with but I don't regret it a bit. It has been able to handle anything I throw at it so far. From a triple batch of brownies to dough for my tamales. Go ahead and bite the bullet, you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Large and quiet. My wife initially didnt want to give up her old (smaller) kitchenaid and figured she would use both....until she used this bad boy. The old model was already offered out to friends and she is not looking back.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Large capacity bowel & powerful mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love this big mixer. Was able to mash my potatoes for Christmas in the 7 quart bowel.( My hand held mixer could not reach the bottom of the large pan.) It takes a little practice to get use to putting the bowel in place but that Was not a problem. Like using it for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Mattie to 3 grandsons

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: Arrived 14 days early in prime condition. Works like a dream, no ticking at all. There is no comparison between the quietness of this machine and the Hobart machines that I work with.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Budd

customer_reviews.title: Literally use it every weekend.
customer_reviews.text: Mixer works great, I bake alot of bread and make dumplings alot and it works effortlessly. Big step up from the 5qt mixer I used to have. Would recommend to anyone who has a serious use for it. High speed also works great for beating egg whites and making fresh whipped cream.
customer_reviews.author: Vytas Vaitkus

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted one of these for quite long time. I have 2 5qt stand mixers, which I love. But needed to upgrade. I am so happy to have finally been able to. The mixer does click when under a heavy load, but still quieter than my other mixers. And does a fabulous job making breads, cookies, and everything I have thrown at it so far. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Damus

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a true kitchen work horse. It was able to mix and knead 12 batches of 10 cups of flour dough in 90 mins. By hand it used to take us 2 hours with 8 people. We only needed 3 people with the mixer
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Franck

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge, well made and hopefully will become something we can pass down. We will mainly use it for baking, but I have done a couple of other quick mixing jobs with it. It is large, powerful and what I expect from a Kitchen aid mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence R. Schmitz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: GF loves this thing! She freakishly brags about it to everyone too. Works awesome. Gets expensive after a few attachments, but they are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: stonegamts

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gift!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my girlfriend. She loves it!!! She says that it makes baking so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Benavides

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I really like my mixer I had a couple before and they're always wonderful and easy to used
customer_reviews.author: Ive

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is wonderful. I got it just in time for Christmas cookies and there is one kind that is really hard to mix. This mixer did the job like there was nothing to it. I was amazed. So far nothing has been beyond the ability of this mixer. I just love it and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Chugg

customer_reviews.title: This is my third kitchenaid stand mixer and the better
customer_reviews.text: I have all the attachments for this stand mixer, is not noise like others models and is super powerful. I make bread and pizza mixes, pasta grind meats. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my daughter who is a baker and she loves it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela V. Martin

customer_reviews.title: For serious cooking only
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy, gorgeous color and saves my mixin arms and hands
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, functional, and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mixer. I love every single part of it.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't give it up for anything
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome mixer has plenty power and is very quiet
customer_reviews.author: Obie f.

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever
customer_reviews.text: We have had several different mixers over the last 48 years, but never one that does the job as well as this one. I bought the larger one with the thought that it is possible to have one that is too small requiring mixing several batches. This size makes that unnecessary for anything that we mix. Oh, yes, it is made in America also.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: I love my new mixer
customer_reviews.text: I love my new mixer! I've developed carpal tunnel syndrome over the years, and finally decided to purchase a stand mixer. What a huge difference! Everything is so much easier, and cleanup isn't bad either. The larger bowl size enables me to make my bread doughs, large batches of cookie dough, or even multiple batches of cake batter at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color!
customer_reviews.text: It was what I was looking for but my bowl did not quite line up with the hooks. It’s a battle every time I want to use it but not worth the hassle to return. I’ll eventually buy a new bowl. The mixer itself is a dream!
customer_reviews.author: frankie edwards

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: As always the quality shows from kitchenaid, powerful, superb finish, quality attachments, quiet!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Like Mary Poppins
customer_reviews.text: Practically Perfect in Every Way Takes some practice to get the bowl on properly. I bought this because America's Test Kitchen recommended it, as usual, they are right.
customer_reviews.author: Mickeycat

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my mom and she loves it. I know a lot of people complain about the “tick tick” sound that the machine made but we didn’t have that issue, It was as quiet as a mouse. The package came in perfect condition and also earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: All in all great mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet compared to my 5 year old 6qt mixer. The clicking sound only presumes with a heavy dough such as bread but nothing crazy loud! All in all great mixer!!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Davis

customer_reviews.title: Terrific mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the KitchenAid mixer we bought ages ago, but this is indeed even better and heavier.
customer_reviews.author: CNY

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: Love the red color! Powerful and easy to use. This replaced a smaller KitchenAid and I am very happy with it. Fast shipping and very well packaged!
customer_reviews.author: Anna Elder

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer but rather noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for cake and breadmaking but noisiest Kitchenaid mixer yet and this is our 5th one in 28 years. We really put our mixers through a lot of torcher. Daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Jeeves57

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid piece of equipment that can be a workhorse and last for years. Well build and no vibrations. If you're going to use it a lot then go for this larger model. Larger bowl and upgraded components make it worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Dermot Somers

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended, top seller
customer_reviews.text: fast delivery and top price, highly recommended, top seller, much cheaper than Germany, top product and keeps what it promises. But you have a 110 volt connection.
customer_reviews.author: Marco V.

customer_reviews.title: I'm sold!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st table mixer always had a top of the line hand mixer.This past weekend I made 3 batches of different cookies an baked a loaf of garlic herb bread an the outcome was more than tasty! The ease of the mixer made my job really easy normally I would be tired after all that baking but I let the mixer do the work an it did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: And I'm amazed at the difference
customer_reviews.text: I went from a kitchen aid 5qt+ model to a 7qt. And I'm amazed at the difference. The 7qt. Is so quiet compared to the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a monster!
customer_reviews.text: Every Kitchen needs this! My wife and I love it. This is the largest size they make, it fits under our top cabinets on the countertop but I would recommend measuring before you buy! This thing is a monster!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Love this Mixer
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer! It is very sturdy, love the large mixing bowl and the fact that i can triple my buttercream frosting recipe without overheating the mixer!!
customer_reviews.author: Sugar Rush Sweets

customer_reviews.title: Overheating
customer_reviews.text: Kept overheatring and now looks like there is a wiring short.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I am so excited! It looks and runs fabulously ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so excited! It looks and runs fabulously! Came early with all the attachments and the metal bowl. Which is the one I wanted! The mixer is quite and runs perfectly! Thank you so much, I could not have afforded this without Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Alisa Cherié Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Oh my what's not to like! It sure is making my cooking/baking life easier.
customer_reviews.author: D  Conner

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This is like buying a new car for me! What an upgrade from my regular KitchenAid mixer. Its so quiet for the power. I like all of the attachments & the bowl design. The progressive start is great. I don't get sprayed with flour or liquids anymore! I really do love this mixer. No issues yet!
customer_reviews.author: Jarmuz

customer_reviews.title: great mixer
customer_reviews.text: these mixers are great I wore out two of them in 12 years and can easily get replacement parts from manufacturer even on discontinued colors.
customer_reviews.author: Tom J.

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it. I love how quiet it is compared ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. I love how quiet it is compared to my 600 which may have been a lemon. Handles large batches of cookies really well.
customer_reviews.author: momtoboys

customer_reviews.title: Out of box, paddle bottomed out in metal bowl ...
customer_reviews.text: Out of box, paddle bottomed out in metal bowl midway through bowl lift procedure. Followed the. Kitchenaide procedure as outlined in their guide and still could not get paddle to clear bowl. Full replacement from Kitchenaide had same result. Made video to show Kitchenaide and they cannot explain product failure
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Murray

customer_reviews.title: ease of use
customer_reviews.text: i really like this. it makes it easy to mix ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Irene Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Love this mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second kitchaid mixer in 30 years. I love this mixer for making bread and large batches of cookies. It is much quieter than my last one. I believe this is the best mixer on the market. I love all my kitchen aid products!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pro
customer_reviews.text: Powerful! If you are going to make large amounts, this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Rockstein

customer_reviews.title: very usable
customer_reviews.text: very usable, we have many ways to use it for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: sophie

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had my last kitchen aid for 25years love this one just as much
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Had to get it
customer_reviews.text: Well, as you can see from my other posts about the KitchenAid Pro Line Toaster and Electric Kettle, they are candy apple red. Her other mixer was a duller red and had to be replaced to match the new ones. Ha ha ha. Actually, we have a big family and usually feed 12-20 adults on holidays. This makes it easier to make LOTS of mashed potatoes. Also ordered the 8 qt bowl. That took a while to get here, but is a nice option as she now has two mixers and three bowls ...
customer_reviews.author: Rich Colvin

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful machine that will be passed on to the next generation!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Rookey

customer_reviews.title: Nevertheless excellent
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we didn't realise the voltage and had to buy a converter. Nevertheless excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lobo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great improvement over my last proline mixer. It is quieter, and more powerful not to mention more colorful!
customer_reviews.author: Pasta Lover

customer_reviews.title: My mom's had it for a few weeks now for ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom's had it for a few weeks now for the holidays and loves it, haven't seen the oven off in a few days. Powerful but quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Thes one & Double K

customer_reviews.title: Mechanical Heaven!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive quality! My Pro 600 is a good mixer, but the difference is like driving a '63 Rambler and switching to a '14 Lexus. "Fit & Feel" are amazing to the eyes, the touch, and production. Quiet? My 600 was hard to talk over, the Proline 7 is hard to hear. Happy with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Knudtson

customer_reviews.title: I and my hubby are very happy with the machine
customer_reviews.text: Delivered to Japan, it's working well here. I and my hubby are very happy with the machine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, and it didn't take a long time for it to be shipped to China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Have never owned a mixer with this much power. It handles three large loafs of of dough without heating the motor. Quiet, strong. I use speed one for kneading dough, takes a little longer but seems to do a better job than speed two. I recommend it to anyone who believes you pay for what you get. Is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product already made many tins of cookies for the holiday
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Abelowitz

customer_reviews.title: My daughter really liked it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter who went to culinary arts school. She really liked it and said it was an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jose R Lim

customer_reviews.title: We use it a lot and it is the best blender in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: We had at least 4 kitchen aids blenders before this one that broke because of high load. this one is a beast and much quieter. No matter what we throw in, it takes it with ease. We use it a lot and it is the best blender in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Lagavulin Talisker

customer_reviews.title: I have had a KitchenAid for 30 years this purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had a KitchenAid for 30 years this purchase was for my son and his new wife. Now they can get the attachments from family!
customer_reviews.author: agnewfarms

customer_reviews.title: Bringing back fun into the kitchen...
customer_reviews.text: Love having hands free to do other tasks while whipping, mixing, stirring, or kneading... great little device. I like the extra size of the bowl and the extra power for when one needs to knead.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: It is so pretty. I cannot describe how pleased she was to ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a gorgeous appliance. My daughter got this from us for Christmas. She was thrilled. It is so pretty. I cannot describe how pleased she was to get this mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Great but had a couple of knicks in the paint.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous, but there were a few Knicks in the red paint so I am giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: The best mixer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: The best mixer I've ever had. The most powerful, yet extremely quiet. It's also very large (i.e. capacity) I LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rico Suave

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Everything works well. It takes a little time to get used to fixing the bowl in place. Other than that, great product!
customer_reviews.author: ~*~Minnie~*~

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, very powerful, doesn't heat up! I just wish there were more accessories for it though. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If it makes Mamma happy, then Mamma makes daddy happy! Its the s***! !
customer_reviews.author: Jack Collier

customer_reviews.title: I bought this mixer for my wife as a gift ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mixer for my wife as a gift I asked her how she likes it and she says she loves it she said it's very powerful
customer_reviews.author: JEFF011

customer_reviews.title: It was a Christmas present for my daughter and she ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas present for my daughter and she loves it. I have owned a 5th is certainly 1978 and it is still going strong but we needed one with à larger càpacity.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelin Langenbach

customer_reviews.title: $450.00 for this?
customer_reviews.text: Box heavily taped. When opened the Styrofoam inside was shattered into pieces. Finish was chipped in several places, and when I turned it on the beater hits the side of the bowl.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ricci

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Great great...my wife loves it....starting a small business and this was the ticket! Metal gears vs plastic...will post more after multiple uses...
customer_reviews.author: Alexander R. McKinley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Alignment issues
customer_reviews.text: Despite multiple height adjustments, the beater, whisk, and dough hook were striking the bowl. This occurred even when the bowl was in the down position. Other than the gross misalignment, it is a beautiful stand mixer. I am returning this unit with fingers crossed that the replacement unit will function normally.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrena Bedwell

customer_reviews.title: did not like that there is no instruction how to fit the ...
customer_reviews.text: did not like that there is no instruction how to fit the bowl on. it is difficult to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Ben-Zion

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: No tilt feature. Awkward to use. 5 qt we have is much more user friendly. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: James J.

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to make pizza dough. I had previously had a smaller less powerful mixer and wanted something larger which could handle dough better. For my first try, I used 8 cups of flour. The mixer struggled and stalled, and got quite hot. It was just unable to handle the load. I divided the dough in half - less than I previously put into a much less powerful mixer - and it still struggled. The bowl clamp mechanism was flexing left and right, and kept popping out of the rear clip which keeps the bowl level. Overall, this is NOT a good mixer for dough.
customer_reviews.author: N. W. Jaffe

customer_reviews.title: The cover that doesn't fit isn't really a problem
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I was sent the wrong color which doesn't bother me. I also had the same issue with the shield not fitting correctly. I called Kitchenaid support and was told the cover doesn't clip on and it's supposed to just sit on top of the mixing bowl. So, wanting to believe it, I feel much better. I suppose you could Mickey Mouse a solution but I'm going with what I was told. I know I'm going to love this machine. No clicking sound and much quieter than my last one that worked 31 years. The spring latch broke and I can fix it for about $15.00. But when Daddy wants an upgrade, it becomes reality.
customer_reviews.author: T. White

customer_reviews.title: I love it so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! But, sheesh: 7 Q is big! I would prefer a glass bowl, but the metal bowl is okay. Had to clean it repeatedly (6 times) to get the polish off. Even so, didn't get everything. Lemon and salt worked best. Baking powder and water worked a little. Dish detergent did nothing. I got a free (rebate) spiralizer with it, which is great. I haven't used it much, yet. But I know I'm going to enjoy it. Very versatile. I look forward to getting more attachments. Also, I'm very sensitive to loud machines. I had read some comments that some of these were loud. I don't find this to be loud at all.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: It’s Beautiful and Runs Like A Dream 💫
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The candy apple 🍎 Red color is beautiful. The mixer runs like a dream. Easy set up! Yes, there is some noise, but it has a decent sized bowl... so that’s to be expected. I will be using it for hair care products. Wishes: I would most definitely like to see a 7-Qt plastic and glass bowl as options so I can use either or. That would be the icing on the cake. Buy it... you can thank me later. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Keiani Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: So happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad that I read the reviews on this Pro Line,I already purchased the professional series a few days before reading the reviews and I decided to return it for the Pro Line,what a difference between them. The professional was very loud and seem to strain where the Pro Line is much more powerful and not that loud at all. If you are looking for a KitichenAide the Pro Line is worth the extra money...
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: DC motors rule
customer_reviews.text: I let the smoke out of my previous Kitchenaid mixer and it was beyond the return period offered for a refurb. I finally did the research I should have done previously and found that the versions that use DC motors don't suffer the problems under high load that the AC motor versions do. If you use the bread-hook, get one with a DC motor.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Phlogiston Theory

customer_reviews.title: At long last - no disappointments here!
customer_reviews.text: After wanting one of these for years, it was pretty darn exciting to finally get one. So far I have made meat loaf, shredded chicken barbecue, cakes, cookies, and pasta (with the KA pasta roller and cutter attachments), and it really is a joy to use. I have checked out some library books on cooking with a mixer and found all sorts of interesting recipes, not just desserts. Since we're watching our weight, I will been getting creative to see that this earns it's counter space. That's a challenge I am enjoying already.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Love my New KitchenAid 7-Quart Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my Mother's Day present for this year. Over the weekend, my existing KitchenAid died. I had stripped the gears because I had used it so much for making bread for our neighbors and us. I wiped it down, and made a double batch of bread today. I noticed how quiet it is compared to my older, worn-out one. I would recommend to everyone to read the instructions thoroughly and when you are making bread, keep it on #2 like the instructions say. Even though the instructions say that you can put the pieces in the dishwasher, I will always wash things by hand.
customer_reviews.author: MamaD

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love the size. I do a lot of baking so having the larger bowl is really nice. It is much quieter than my 6 qt, which is great on my ears. The only complaint that I have is the paddle still hits the side of the bowl, in a way it shouldn't, even after adjusting it. Thankfully I have not found any bowl pieces in it, just a little annoying in the sound that it makes.
customer_reviews.author: SMAtlanta

customer_reviews.title: It purrs like a kitten
customer_reviews.text: I got it out of the box today, washed the attachments and gave it a test drive. It purrs like a kitten! I don't have any of the loud clicking sounds as described by some users. There was a slight ticking sound in the beginning while using the paddle and whisk attachments but after just the slightest of bowl adjustments, which took about 15 seconds, it was gone. Not to mention it's a gorgeous looking machine. I'm glad I made the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Ash

customer_reviews.title: All KitchenAids are not equal.
customer_reviews.text: This broke after 5 years. My previous one had it 20 years and never had one problem. This one always struggled to make dough.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtyred

customer_reviews.title: Powerful beautiful, it is not loud as some reviews say. Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more excited. It's a beautiful red! I've wanted one with a lift bowl for years. I read reviews that the mixer was loud, it's not as loud as my Artisan mixer. It has so much power. I love it! Can't say enough about how happy I am with it!
customer_reviews.author: jw

customer_reviews.title: I like the 7 quart bowl capacity but think that it ...
customer_reviews.text: Beats Not as fast as my older one, but I guess it should last longer than. Much quieter than the older one. I like the 7 quart bowl capacity but think that it is longer than wider and not as comfortable to work with if it would be more proportional.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Grigoryev

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful mixer
customer_reviews.text: I really really LOVE this mixer. My previous kitchen aid was only 5 quart and was not large enough for my recipe. I could not buy the 7 qt locally so had to order online.. This not only works great but the candy apple red looks so great you do not want to put a cover over it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and energy in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who loves to cook and bake. She thought they were too expensive and held off buying one for years. She now says she doesn't know how she ever lived without it. It makes cooking so much easier and time efficient. The 7-quart size is fantastic for big batches and the red color is gorgeous.
customer_reviews.author: ShanDoo

product_meta.title: KitchenAid KSM7586PCA 7-Quart Pro Line Stand Mixer Candy Apple Red
product_meta.description: This is the largest, most powerful, but quietest KitchenAid stand mixer available. The generous seven-quart-capacity mixer has commercial-grade, high-performance features for efficiency and high quality results every time you use it. The 1.3-horsepower motor mixes and kneads quietly, and features ten speeds from slow stirring to high beating. The commercial design includes bowl lift and metal knobs, and the mixer’s planetary action allows attachments to spin independently while making continual rotations around the bowl for thorough mixing. The polished seven-quart-capacity stainless steel bowl has a comfort handle and plenty of room for all your needs. The professional-grade elliptical whip attachment has 11 stainless steel wires that operate 33% faster than typical whips for optimal aeration of egg whites or cream. The mixer also comes with a flat beater and dough hook. Makes up to 14 dozen cookies or 8 lbs. of dough. The commercial power hub works with all KitchenAid attachments. Hand assembled in Greenville, Ohio, home of KitchenAid since 1919. 7-qt. capacity. 25 lbs.; 16¼" h x 14¾" l x 13¼" w. Work bowl is dishwasher safe, wipe machine and attachments clean. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Largest Capacity Residential Bowl-Lift Stand Mixer Available
Includes Powerknead™ Spiral Dough Hook, Flat Beater, and Stainless Steel Wire Whip
